abstract: Less stringent capital and liquidity requirements for banks for the world’s banks will help bolster the global economic recovery, which is needed most right now.
snippet: Less stringent capital and liquidity requirements for banks for the world’s banks will help bolster the global economic recovery, which is needed most right now.
lead_paragraph: When a global committee of regulators and central bankers agreed to a new set of rules for the banking system a year and a half ago, Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, told The Financial Times, “I’m very close to thinking the United States shouldn’t be in Basel anymore. I would not have agreed to rules that are blatantly anti-American.”

headline.main: Easing of Rules for Banks Acknowledges Reality
headline.print_headline: Easing of Rules For Banks Acknowledges Reality

abstract: James E. Staley, a longtime JPMorgan Chase executive who served as the firm’s head of investment banking until a management shake-up last year, is leaving the bank to join the hedge fund BlueMountain Capital Management as a managing partner.
snippet: James E. Staley, a longtime JPMorgan Chase executive who served as the firm’s head of investment banking until a management shake-up last year, is leaving the bank to join the hedge fund BlueMountain Capital Management as a managing partner.
lead_paragraph: The former head of JPMorgan Chase’s investment bank is leaving to join a hedge fund that profited by going against JPMorgan in a bet on corporate debt that left the bank with a multibillion-dollar loss.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Staley to Join BlueMountain Capital
headline.print_headline: A Top Official At JPMorgan Is Departing After Big Loss

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: JPMorgan Chase has hired T. Timothy Ryan Jr., the president and chief executive of the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association, to be its new top regulatory officer.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase has hired T. Timothy Ryan Jr., the president and chief executive of the Securities Industry and Financial Markets Association, to be its new top regulatory officer.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase announced on Tuesday that it had hired T. Timothy Ryan Jr., a senior Wall Street lobbyist, as its new top regulatory officer.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Securities Industry and Financial Markets Assn

abstract: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York after his second three-year term expired at the end of December.
snippet: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York after his second three-year term expired at the end of December.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, has left the board of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, a position that had stirred some controversy after the bank’s big trading loss last year.

headline.main: Dimon Leaves New York Fed Board as His Term Ends
